page.title: 17TOURISM IN CHARLBURY
page.content: As Charlbury is in the Cotswolds, man tourists visit this area. Five and a half thousand people stay at the local Youth Hostel in one year. 1800 are English children.1100 are from abroad.They come from USA,Australia,New Zealand,Canada,Europe and a few from Japan.They mostly come in May,June and early July.Visitors arrive on foot, bike,coach,car and train.Over the years the numbers have not increased apart from 1977 until 1979 when the figures were six and a half thousand.The Hostel hold 50 people but soon it will be able to hold 62. There are also,in Charlbury,two Hotels.These are The Bell and The Bull. The Bell Hotel is well known and was built in the 1700's.Many residents also offer bed and breakfast facilities. Within easy reach of Charlbury are Stratford,Blenheim Palace and Oxford.
